title: Are thoughts actually biological molecules in the brain? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. It's hard to define thoughts in physical terms, but they are certainly not molecules. Thoughts are an emergent property of our complex neural processes. In other words, a thought is more akin to a weather system: areas of high pressure, areas of low pressure; wind, rain, the occasional storm, but the basic ingredients (air, pressure, movement) are the same before and after. Thoughts are more complex than weather fronts, but the basic metaphor holds: the neurons, action potentials and neurotransmitters are present before and after a thought. What changes is their behaviour not their chemistry.

There have been recent studies in mice looking at how memories are formed from the neural network in the brain and how (as mentioned) the totality of the network forms a thought or a memory. Not just one neuron or even tens of neurons.
